comment: Racism is such a nasty infection , and unfortunately , it's found on both sides of the aisle , even by those who think they are calling it out . We shouldn't turn a blind eye , but at the same time , we should be careful in what we call racist .
amr:

      :snt1 (a / and
            :op1 (ii / infect-01
                  :ARG2 (r / racism)
                  :mod (n / nasty
                        :degree (s / such)))
            :op2 (f / find-01
                  :ARG0 (p / person
                        :mod (t / that)
                        :ARG0-of (t2 / think-01
                              :ARG1 (c / call-out-15
                                    :ARG0 p
                                    :ARG1 (r2 / racism)))
                        :mod (e / even))
                  :ARG1 r
                  :ARG2 (s2 / side
                        :mod (b / both)
                        :part-of (a2 / aisle))
                  :ARG2-of (f2 / fortunate-01
                        :polarity -)))
      :snt2 (c2 / contrast-01
            :ARG1 (r3 / recommend-01
                  :ARG1 (t3 / turn-18
                        :polarity -
                        :ARG0 (w / we)
                        :ARG1 (e2 / eye
                              :ARG1-of (b2 / blind-02))))
            :ARG2 (r4 / recommend-01
                  :ARG1 (c3 / care-04
                        :ARG0 w
                        :ARG1 (t4 / thing
                              :ARG1-of (c4 / call-01
                                    :ARG0 w
                                    :ARG2 (r5 / racist))))
                  :time (t5 / time
                        :ARG1-of (s3 / same-01)))))

comment: I've been called because of something seemingly innocent I've said , but because I'm white I'm judged for saying those things . Or a look I give someone . But if I direct that expression to a white person , I'm no longer racist . I think I see a double standard .
amr:

            :ARG2 (j / judge-01
                  :ARG1 ii
                  :ARG2 (s4 / say-01

                        :ARG1 (t / thing
                              :mod (t2 / that)))
                  :ARG1-of (c4 / cause-01
                        :ARG0 (w / white-02
                              :ARG1 ii))))
      :snt2 (o / or
            :op2 (l / look-01
                  :ARG0 (ii3 / i)
                  :ARG2 (s5 / someone)))
      :snt3 (c5 / contrast-01
            :ARG2 (r / racist
                  :domain (ii4 / i)
                  :time (n / no-longer)
                  :condition (d / direct-01
                        :ARG0 ii4
                        :ARG1 (e / express-01
                              :mod (t3 / that))
                        :ARG2 (p / person
                              :ARG1-of (w2 / white-02)))))
      :snt4 (t4 / think-01
            :ARG0 (ii5 / i)
            :ARG1 (s6 / see-01
                  :ARG0 ii5
                  :ARG1 (s7 / standard
                        :mod (d2 / double)))))

comment: That is ridiculous . I'm white and not racist . And I happen to be related to some Olympic-level racists . Unless that is just considered a rude gesture in another country I don't get it . If it was considered racist or offensive , ignorance of that fact does not equal racist .

      :snt4 (g2 / get-01
            :polarity -
            :ARG0 (ii3 / i)
            :ARG1 (ii4 / it)
            :condition (c / consider-01
                  :ARG1 (g3 / gesture-01

                  :ARG2 (t2 / that)
                  :location (c2 / country
                        :mod (a3 / another))
                  :mod (j / just)))
      :snt5 (e / equal-01

comment: Racism is the thought that one race is better than another based on the virtue of them being different . Behaving in a racist way includes : telling racist jokes , using slurs in a derogatory way , treating somebody of a race poorly or differently only because of their race .
amr:

      :snt1 (t / think-01
            :ARG1 (g / good-02
                  :ARG1 (r / race
                        :mod (o / one))
                  :ARG2-of (h / have-degree-91
                        :ARG1 r
                        :ARG3 (m2 / more)
                        :ARG4 (r2 / race
                              :mod (a / another))))
            :ARG1-of (b / base-02
                  :ARG2 (v / virtue
                        :domain (d / differ-02
                              :ARG1 r))))
      :snt2 (ii / include-01
            :ARG1 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (j / joke-01
                        :mod (r3 / racist))
                  :op2 (u / use-01
                        :ARG1 (s / slur)
                        :manner (d2 / derogatory))
                  :op3 (t2 / treat-01
                        :ARG1 (s2 / somebody
                              :mod (r4 / race)
                              :poss-of r4)
                        :ARG2 (o2 / or
                              :op1 (p / poor)
                              :op2 d))
                  :ARG1-of (c / cause-01
                        :ARG0 (r5 / race
                              :poss s2)
                        :mod (o3 / only))))
      :ARG2 (b2 / behave-01
            :manner (r6 / racist)))

comment: There's nothing wrong with that definition except in how's it applied . If I'm standing in a group of black guys . One tells a racist joke about black people . Everyone laughs , including me . They aren't racist , but I am . That's the double standard . Perhaps I didn't find it funny ...
